name: London
description: London, the capital city of England, is a vibrant and bustling metropolis that offers a wealth of experiences for budget travellers. With its rich history, diverse culture, and stunning architecture, London is a city that never fails to impress. From the iconic Big Ben and the Tower Bridge to the modern Shard and the London Eye, the city's skyline is a sight to behold. London is a melting pot of cultures, with a vibrant arts scene, world-class museums, and a thriving music and theatre scene. The city is home to some of the world's most famous museums, including the British Museum, the National Gallery, and the Tate Modern. For those interested in history, the Tower of London is a must-visit, while the Houses of Parliament and Buckingham Palace are also popular attractions. London is also known for its festivals and events, with something happening almost every week. From the Notting Hill Carnival to the Christmas markets, there is always something to see and do. The city is also famous for its food, with a wide range of international cuisines on offer. From traditional fish and chips to Indian curries and Chinese dim sum, there is something for everyone. One of the most surprising facts about London is that it is home to over 8 million people, making it one of the largest cities in the world. Despite its size, however, the city is easy to navigate, with an extensive public transport system that includes buses, trains, and the famous London Underground. For budget travellers, there are plenty of free or low-cost attractions to enjoy. The city's parks, including Hyde Park and Regent's Park, are perfect for a picnic or a leisurely stroll. The Southbank Centre and the National Theatre offer free performances and events throughout the year, while the street art in Shoreditch and Camden is a must-see.

address.streetAddress: Greater London Authority, City Hall, The Queen's Walk

name: British Museum
description: The British Museum: A Budget Traveller's Dream Come True! Hey there, fellow budget travellers! I'm CheapTrip.Guru, and I'm here to share with you my latest discovery in London - the British Museum. Now, I know what you're thinking - museums are boring and expensive. But trust me, this one is different. First of all, let's talk about the price. The best part? It's completely free! That's right, you can explore the wonders of the British Museum without spending a single penny. And let me tell you, there are plenty of wonders to explore. From the Rosetta Stone to the Egyptian mummies, the British Museum is home to some of the most fascinating artefacts in the world. And the best part? You don't have to be a history buff to appreciate them. Even if you're not particularly interested in ancient civilisations, you'll still find yourself in awe of the sheer scale and beauty of these artefacts. But the British Museum isn't just about the past. It's also a hub of contemporary art and culture. There are always new exhibitions and events taking place, so be sure to check out their website before you go. And let's not forget about the building itself. The British Museum is housed in a stunning neoclassical building that is a work of art in itself. You could spend hours just admiring the architecture and the beautiful courtyard. So, if you're looking for a budget-friendly activity in London that is both educational and entertaining, look no further than the British Museum. And if you see me there, be sure to say hi - I'll be the one geeking out over the Rosetta Stone. Until next time, happy travels!

name: National Gallery
description:
The National Gallery: A Masterpiece of Art and Budget Travel! Hey there, fellow budget travellers! I'm CheapTrip.Guru, your go-to guide for affordable adventures. Today, I want to share with you my experience at the National Gallery in London. 
Now, I know what you're thinking. "Art museums? That's not exactly budget-friendly." But hear me out. The National Gallery is not only a cultural gem, but it's also completely free to enter. That's right, folks. You can soak up some of the world's most famous art without spending a single penny. 
But wait, there's more! The National Gallery also offers free guided tours and audio guides. So, not only will you save money, but you'll also get a more in-depth understanding of the art and its history. 
Now, I'm not an art expert by any means, but even I was blown away by the collection at the National Gallery. From Van Gogh to Da Vinci, there's something for everyone. And the best part? You don't have to be an art connoisseur to appreciate it. 
But let's get real for a second. We all know that art museums can be a bit stuffy and boring. That's where the National Gallery breaks the mold. The building itself is a work of art, with stunning architecture and a beautiful central courtyard. And if you're feeling peckish, there's a café on site that won't break the bank. 
So, what are you waiting for? Add the National Gallery to your London itinerary and experience the beauty of art without breaking the bank. And don't forget to snap some pics for the 'gram using #budgettravel and #NationalGalleryLondon. 
Until next time, happy travels! 
- CheapTrip.Guru

item.name: The Diana Memorial Playground
item.description: This playground is inspired by Peter Pan and is designed for kids up to the age of 12. It features a pirate ship, teepees, and a sensory trail.

item.name: SEA LIFE London Aquarium

address.streetAddress: County Hall, Riverside Building, Westminster Bridge Rd, Bishop's

item.description: The SEA LIFE London Aquarium has over 600 species of marine life, including sharks, turtles, and penguins. It also features interactive exhibits and a glass walkway over the shark tank.

item.name: London Zoo
item.description: London Zoo is home to over 750 species of animals, including gorillas, tigers, and penguins. It also features interactive exhibits, a children's zoo, and a playground.
